Name: Osiris
Description: This figurine of bronze belongs to a group of 14 similar objects which have been found during the excavations of the Oxford University Expedition at Kawa, a town to the south of the 3rd cataract. It depicts, in a very classical way, the god Osiris standing. Wearing the atef-crown, the son of Geb and Nut is covered in a skintight vest, holding the heqa-sceptre (crook) and the flagellum in his hands.
